alert.note: Alert for La Crosse; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 27 at 7:11AM CDT until October 30 at 8:12AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River Near Galesville affecting Trempealeau and La Crosse Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River near Galesville. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM CDT Friday was 14.7 feet. The river appears to be cresting this morning. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday evening and continue falling to 6.1 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.6 feet on 04/01/1967. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 715 PM CDT.
